description.h2: The ASCII text of link:label must be a string of fewer than 511 characters with no consecutive XML whitespace characters and no occurrences of '<' unless its xlink:role attribute is 'http://www.xbrl.org/2003/label/documentation'.
description.p: ASCII character 60 (decimal) and the following ASCII sequences are prohibited in the content of labels other than documentation labels: < < &#x3C.

REMARK: This only applies to company extension label linkbases. If a standard taxonomy label linkbase appearing in edgartaxonomies.xml violated this rule it would be included in a 'good' test variation.

variation.name: 6.10.6, a documentation label that is over 1000 characters with the special character '<', GOOD.
variation.description: a documentation label that is over 1000 characters with the special character '<', GOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.6, a standard label of 562 characters, NOGOOD.
variation.description: a standard label of 562 characters, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.6, a verbose label containing < character, NOGOOD.
variation.description: a verbose label containing < character, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.6, a standard label containing > character which used to be 'special', GOOD.
variation.description: a standard label containing > character which used to be 'special', GOOD.
